CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions);Pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and was living in GPE . Following his death on DATE , his wife and children expressed their intention to pursue the application .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG expropriated CARDINAL plots of land belonging to the applicant , for the construction of a dam . A committee of experts assessed the value of the land and the relevant amount was paid to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the applicant ’s request of CARDINAL DATE for increased compensation , ORG awarded him MONEY ( TRL ) of additional compensation , plus interest at the statutory rate , as of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first instance court . On DATE TRL CARDINAL was paid to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the execution office informed ORG that they still had to pay the applicant the remaining GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the administration filed an objection against the remaining amount of debt , before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court partially upheld the objection of the administration and concluded that GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL had to be paid to the applicant . The administration ’s request to appeal was dismissed by the court on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG paid ORG CARDINAL to the applicant .
